snippet: WebOS, the TouchPad tablet’s core software, was developed by Palm in about nine months, and former employees said the software was deeply flawed because of the way it was built.
abstract: WebOS, core software for Hewlett-Packard's failed TouchPad tablet, was developed by Palm in about nine months, and former employees say the software was deeply flawed; failed gamble illustrates how hard it will be for anyone to mount a serious challenge to Apple and Google's mobile operating systems.
lead_paragraph: WebOS, the TouchPad tablet’s core software, was developed by Palm in about nine months, and former employees said the software was deeply flawed because of the way it was built.

headline.seo: H.P.’s TouchPad, Some Say, Was Built on Flawed Software
headline.main: In Flop of H.P. TouchPad, an Object Lesson for the Tech Sector
headline.print_headline: In Flop of H.P. TouchPad, an Object Lesson for the Tech Sector
